feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: HTML5 app not showing in BTP Cockpit After deployed
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I know there are some similar questions but I can not figure it out the problem.
This is the log I got once application is deployed to html5, but I can not make it appear in html5 application list.

#2025 11 03 22:36:55.840#Z#DEBUG#8277ce9a-b905-11f0-8071-eeee0a92e238.CSR-app-content_CSR-repo-host#flowable-async-job-executor-thread-5683#
[PollDeployContentStatusExecution] [CSR-app-content] [INFO] Application content was successfully uploaded from subaccount { CODE: '1002' }#
 
This is my mta.yaml, I have both unmanaged router and managed router applications. This module CSR-app-content is doing the deployment, log does not show error when deploying but app does not show in list - tried refresh as well.  unmanaged app deploys and works with no problem. I am doing managed to use launchpad functionality.
 
Please your suggestion.
_schema-version: 3.3.0
ID: CSR
description: CSR CAP project.
version: 1.0.0
modules:
- name: isbncertificatesrv
  type: nodejs
  path: gen/srv
  properties:
    DEBUG: sap-cloud-sdk:*
  requires:
  - name: isbncertificate-auth
  - name: isbn-postgres
  - name: isbn-destination-service
  - name: isbn-connector-connectivity
  provides:
  - name: srv-api
    properties:
      srv-url: ${default-url}
  parameters:
    buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
    instances: 1
  build-parameters:
    builder: npm-ci
- name: csr-app-postgres-deployer
  type: nodejs
  path: gen/pg
  requires:
  - name: isbn-postgres
  parameters:
    buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
    disk-quota: 1GB
    memory: 1GB
    no-route: true
    no-start: true
    tasks:
    - command: npm start
      disk-quota: 1GB
      memory: 1GB
      name: deploy-to-postgresql
  build-parameters:
    ignore:
    - node_modules/
- name: isbncertificateui
  type: nodejs
  path: app
  requires:
  - name: srv-api
    group: destinations
    properties:
      forwardAuthToken: true
      name: srv-api
      url: ~{srv-url}
  - name: isbncertificate-auth
  provides:
  - name: app-api
    properties:
      app-protocol: ${protocol}
      app-uri: ${default-uri}
  parameters:
    buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
    disk-quota: 1GB
    keep-existing-routes: true
    memory: 1GB
  build-parameters:
    ignore:
    - default-env.json
    - .env
- name: CSR-app-content
  type: com.sap.application.content
  path: .
  requires:
  - name: CSR-repo-host
    parameters:
      content-target: true
  build-parameters:
    build-result: resources
    requires:
    - artifacts:
      - isbncertificatehtml5isbncertificatehtml5.zip
      name: isbncertificatehtml5isbncertificatehtml5
      target-path: resources/
- name: isbncertificatehtml5isbncertificatehtml5
  type: html5
  path: app/isbncertificatehtml5
  build-parameters:
    build-result: dist
    builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm install
    - npm run build:cf
    supported-platforms: []
resources:
- name: isbncertificate-auth
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    config:
      tenant-mode: dedicated
      xsappname: isbncertificate-${org}-${space}
    path: ./xs-security.json
    service: xsuaa
    service-plan: application
- name: isbn-postgres
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    service: postgresql-db
    service-plan: development
- name: isbn-destination-service
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    config:
      HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
      init_data:
        instance:
          destinations:
          - Authentication: NoAuthentication
            Name: ui5
            ProxyType: Internet
            Type: HTTP
            URL: https://ui5.sap.com
          existing_destinations_policy: update
    service: destination
    service-plan: lite
- name: isbn-connector-connectivity
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    service: connectivity
    service-plan: lite
- name: CSR-repo-host
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    service: html5-apps-repo
    service-name: CSR-html5-service
    service-plan: app-host
parameters:
  deploy_mode: html5-repo
  enable-parallel-deployments: true
build-parameters:
  before-all:
  - builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm ci
    - npx cds build --production
    - bash ./pg-build.sh

entry.title: HTTP 500 when deploying SAPUI5 application to SAP BTP - Build Workzone, standard edition
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am fairly new in BTP SAPUI5 development and I am facing an odd issue. I have an requirement in which I have a standalone SAPUI5 side-by-side application which connects to a CAP microservice that acts as a Proxy to the backend, retrieving the email of the logged user and filtering only data this user can see from the backend. This CAP service is also separate and from Cloud Foundry, I can access its app router authenticated and the CAP service works just fine.

I had deployed both services before without problems, with the only issue is that the SAPUI5 app was not communicating with the CAP service, so I have tried (based on a lot of other blogs, videos etc) to achieve this in the below MTA.yaml file (I can't attach it here):

_schema-version: "3.2"
ID: comclientnameproject
description: Generated by Fiori Tools
version: 0.0.1
modules:
- name: comclientnameproject-destination-content
type: com.sap.application.content
requires:
- name: comclientnameproject-destination-service
parameters:
content-target: true
- name: comclientnameproject-repo-host
parameters:
service-key:
name: comclientnameproject-repo-host-key
- name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
parameters:
content:
instance:
destinations:
- Name: comclientnameproject_html_repo_host
ServiceInstanceName: comclientnameproject-html5-service
ServiceKeyName: comclientnameproject-repo-host-key
sap.cloud.service: comclientnameproject
- Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
Name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
ServiceInstanceName: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
existing_destinations_policy: update
build-parameters:
no-source: true
- name: comclientnameproject-app-content
type: com.sap.application.content
path: .
requires:
- name: comclientnameproject-repo-host
parameters:
content-target: true
build-parameters:
build-result: resources
requires:
- artifacts:
- comclientnameproject.zip
name: comclientnameproject
target-path: resources/
- name: comclientnameproject
type: html5
path: .
build-parameters:
build-result: dist
builder: custom
commands:
- npm install
- npm run build:cf
supported-platforms: []
resources:
- name: comclientnameproject-destination-service
type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
parameters:
config:
HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
init_data:
instance:
destinations:
- Authentication: NoAuthentication
Name: ui5
ProxyType: Internet
Type: HTTP
URL: https://ui5.sap.com
existing_destinations_policy: update
version: 1.0.0
service: destination
service-name: comclientnameproject-destination-service
service-plan: lite
- name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
type: org.cloudfoundry.existing-service
# - name: comclientnameproject-uaa
# type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
# parameters:
# path: ./xs-security.json
# service: xsuaa
# service-name: comclientnameproject-xsuaa-service
# service-plan: application
- name: comclientnameproject-repo-host
type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
parameters:
service: html5-apps-repo
service-name: comclientnameproject-html5-service
service-plan: app-host
parameters:
deploy_mode: html5-repo
enable-parallel-deployments: true


and i have the following ui5-deploy.yaml

parameters:
service: html5-apps-repo
service-name: client-name-html5-service
service-plan: app-host
parameters:
deploy_mode: html5-repo
enable-parallel-deployments: true"

these services exist in Cloud Foundry correctly, but before these changes, the SAPUI5 would load and then show no data. but now it's returning the following error (HTTP 500 - it basically can't find the app structure that was deployed). In the below screenshot, where is censored with red we can read as /com/client/name/project, while in blue it's written comclientnameproject (withou slashes or dots). I am currently using a Trial account as I am waiting for basis team to finish the setup of the account.

It looks like changing it to use MTA and the usage of sap.cloud entry in m manifest.json is somehow making it try to check the folder strucutre of the project that does not reflect how it's built. I'm not sure exaclty how this can be fixed - I never faced an issue like this in on-premise deployments.

has anyone had any problem like this?

thank you,

Erick Grilo

entry.title: Error adding content provider to channel manager
entry.content:
I have created a central tenant which will have content providers for all my sub-accounts.

I am testing with one sub-account, I have modified the nodejs codebase so it generates destinations and then imported these destinations into my central sub-account.

When creating the channel provider I see the destinations and are able to select them, when saving the provider I am getting this error:

<Connectivity/InternalError>: Could not fetch content due to an internal error. Please try again later. If the issue persists, please open a ticket on the connectivity service. 

Can anyone provide any information as to what this error could be related to and where I can look to resolve it?

entry.title: SAPUI5 application in Build Workzone with CAP Application as a proxy to the backend returns 403
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have a scenario that seems to be quite common, but I'm failing to find why exactly the integration between the SAPUI5 and a CAP microsservice is not working. In what follows there are some details:

  • I have a CAP application with an approuter that will act as a intermediate between a simple customized table with data of things that relate to a specific customer. In the backend, there is a configuration that maps an user email with the customer that will be used. The backend itself is a OData service exposed through integration suite. This project was created with the CAP template in Business Application Studio. This part is working pretty much fine: i can access the instance of the CAP service with the approuter from a browser
  • I have a SAPUI5 application which has its own lifecycle, so it lives in a separate repository than the CAP microsservice. This application is hosted in SAP Build Workzone, standard edition, and the objective is to forward any request to the backend to the CAP Microssservice as a proxy to the backend that adds the user ID information (i.e., the email of the logged in user) seamlessly to retrieve data in the backend without the user even knowing that this is happening .

The CAP service works like a charm if I call the endpoint from the Browser:

And now, I want to be able to call this same endpoint from my SAPUi5 application that is hosted in SAP Build workzone. I have seen the documentation of Build Workzone  and went through some tutorials, but all of them shows the case when the UI is deployed altogether with the CAP service in the same repository, which unfortunately is not my case. 

I have went through a lot of blog posts and other questions that looked like a similar error was happening, but I had no luck in fixing so far.

 

Here's my understanding:

  • The CAP app has two service instances managed within its mta: gt-customer-portal-access-auth (technical name xsuaa, plan application) and gt-customer-portal-access-auth (technical name destination, plan lite). They are both binded to the approuter and to the CAP generated service, so it looks good
    below is the MTA of the CAP service:
    _schema-version: 3.3.0
    ID: gt-customer-portal-access
    version: 1.0.0
    description: "A simple CAP project."
    parameters:
      enable-parallel-deployments: true
    build-parameters:
      before-all:
        - builder: custom
          commands:
            - npm ci
            - npx cds build --production
    modules:
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-srv
        type: nodejs
        path: gen/srv
        parameters:
          instances: 1
          buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
        build-parameters:
          builder: npm-ci
        provides:
          - name: srv-api # required by consumers of CAP services (e.g. approuter)
            properties:
              srv-url: ${default-url}
        requires:
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination

      - name: gt-customer-portal-access
        type: approuter.nodejs
        path: app/router
        parameters:
          keep-existing-routes: true
          disk-quota: 256M
          memory: 256M
        requires:
          - name: srv-api
            group: destinations
            properties:
              name: srv-api # must be used in xs-app.json as well
              url: ~{srv-url}
              forwardAuthToken: true
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination
        provides:
          - name: app-api
            properties:
              app-protocol: ${protocol}
              app-uri: ${default-uri}

    resources:
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
        type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
        parameters:
          service: xsuaa
          service-plan: application
          path: ./xs-security.json
          config:
            xsappname: gt-customer-portal-access-gt-br-${space}
            tenant-mode: dedicated
            oauth2-configuration:
              redirect-uris:
                - https://*~{app-api/app-uri}/**
        requires:
          - name: app-api
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination
        type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
        parameters:
          service: destination
          service-plan: lite
    in xs-security.json, I have the following: 
    {
      "xsappname": "gt-customer-portal-access-gt-br-${space}",
      "tenant-mode": "dedicated",
      "oauth2-configuration" : {
        "grant-types" : [
          "authorization_code",
          "password",
          "client_credentials",
          "refresh_token",
          "user_token"
        ]
      },
      "scopes": [
        { "name": "$XSAPPNAME.User", "description": "Default user scope" }
      ],
      "role-templates": [
        {
          "name": "UserRole",
          "description": "Default user role",
          "scope-references": ["$XSAPPNAME.User"]
        }
      ]
    }
    and I have already assigned the UserRole to my User in BTP through a new Role Collection.

    in the approuter, I have the following:

    {
      "routes": [
        {
          "source": "^/(.*)$",
          "target": "$1",
          "destination": "srv-api",
          "csrfProtection": true
        }
      ]
    }
     
  • In my SAPUI5 application, as per some of the documents i've gone through, I should bind the same XSUAA instance that is managed by the CAP Application. So the MTA of the UI5 application is as below (there are some comments as I was trying different approaches to know where exactly the problem could be). Below is the MTA.yaml file of the SAPUI5 app:
    _schema-version: "3.2"
    ID: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    description: Generated by Fiori Tools
    version: 0.0.1
    modules:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    requires:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    parameters:
    content-target: true
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    parameters:
    service-key:
    name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host-key
    - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
    parameters:
    service-key:
    name: key
    parameters:
    content:
    instance:
    destinations:
    - Name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin_html_repo_host
    ServiceInstanceName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-html5-service
    ServiceKeyName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host-key
    sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    #09/11/2025 - abaixo acho que deve apontar pro camarada no CF.
    #- Name: gt-customer-portal-access-aut
    #ServiceInstanceName: gt-customer-portal-access-aut
    #ServiceKeyName: ke
    #Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchang
    #sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigi
    # - Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # ServiceInstanceName:
    # ServiceKeyName:
    # Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # HTML5.DynamicDestination: true
    # sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin_uaa
    # ServiceInstanceName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-xsuaa-service
    # ServiceKeyName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-uaa-key
    # sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    existing_destinations_policy: update
    build-parameters:
    no-source: true
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-app-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    path: .
    requires:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    parameters:
    content-target: true
    build-parameters:
    build-result: resources
    requires:
    - artifacts:
    - comvendorcustomermaterialorigin.zip
    name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    target-path: resources/
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    type: html5
    path: .
    build-parameters:
    build-result: dist
    builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm install
    - npm run build:cf
    supported-platforms: []
    resources:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
    config:
    HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
    init_data:
    instance:
    destinations:
    - Authentication: NoAuthentication
    Name: ui5
    ProxyType: Internet
    Type: HTTP
    URL: https://ui5.sap.com
    - Authentication: NoAuthentication #setar a destination aqui não seria necessário se vc fizer dirteto no BTP. Porém, aparentemente é uma boa prática fazer isso a partir
    #do mta
    Name: portal-clientes-credentials
    ProxyType: Internet
    Type: HTTP
    URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-get-user-email-saml.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    #update abaixo: após voltar o app no Workzone com 403 - ultima tentativa hoje _ 02:24 08/11/2024
    # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # Type: HTTP
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # existing_destinations_policy: update
    version: 1.0.0
    service: destination
    service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    service-plan: lite
    - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
    type: org.cloudfoundry.existing-service
    # parameters:
    # path: ./xs-security.json
    # service: xsuaa
    # service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-xsuaa-service
    # service-plan: application
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
    service: html5-apps-repo
    service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-html5-service
    service-plan: app-host
    parameters:
    deploy_mode: html5-repo
    enable-parallel-deployments: true

  • Note that it refers to the same xsuaa service as in gt-customer-portal-access-auth.

The problem is that when I open the app in build Workzone, the medatada call for the service returns 403 forbidden without even reaching the app router (I Believe so as there is no logs in the service instance, so it's a bit odd)

Note that i have added a call to the service "whoami" as a test service that is in the CAP application and it's returning 404, and if i uncomment this part of the MTA and redeploy:

  • # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # Type: HTTP
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # existing_destinations_policy: update

it also returns 403 now:

I am not sure exactly what needs to be done either in CAP or in the SAPUI5 setup, as it looks like the CAP setup is OK, and most of the documents/blogs says that a destination in BTP level should be enough for the Build workzone approuter to connect to the CAP service. I have this destination setup as below:

Does anyone have gone a similar requirement and managed to make it work? I'm thinking that the approuter generated with my cap app can be the culprit but i'm not sure.

I also checked mostly the capire documents (which always uses the samples of UI5 along with CAP at the same deployment) and the documentation of Build Workzone (mainly https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/developing-html5-applications-and-extensions?locale=en-US and other related topics), but I still had no luck on making it work. There is also a sample in https://github.com/SAP-samples/cap-sflight but it uses an approuter from the SAPUI5, which I understood that is not the case when deployng the application to SAP Build Workzone, standard edition (looks like it has its own approuter).

Really appreciate any inputs,

Erick Grilo.

entry.title: Adapt UI on SAP Fiori app RAP deployed on Cloud Foundry
entry.content:
Hi guys, my backend is SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.SAP Fiori

We developed a RAP application embedded in Public Cloud, and a Fiori frontend on BTP deployed on Cloud Foundry.

Now the user wants to save variants of this app — default values, hidden fields, etc. Basically, they want the Adapt UI functionality that exists in S/4HANA Public Cloud, but for apps deployed on Cloud Foundry and running in Work Zone.

Is this possible?

entry.title: How to enable My Home Tab in SAP BTP CF Launchpad Build Work Zone Standard edition
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am using SAP CF BUILD WORK ZONE STANDARD EDITION for publishing BTP  apps. Back end system is S4 HANA -ON PREMISE 2023 PRIVATE CLOUD.

VIEW MODE :    Space and Page – New Experience.

I need to assign below mentioned BTP roles to my user ID. I am not able to find them in role collection. Please suggest  ?

  • Workzone_Administrator
  • Workzone_Content_Administrator
  • Workzone_Viewer

I am working on enabling SAP BTP Task Center service , Insights . I need these roles to be assigned to my ID to proceed.

entry.title: Launch default app in Build Workzone site
entry.content:
I have a site created in SAP Build Workzone which displays a set of tiles when opened - All apps are maintained and deployed individually.
Do we have any way to set a particular app as the default app or trigger that tile when the site opens. 
Something like redirection or default route that can be configure in the code or site settings.

Do we have any option to set the default route?

entry.title: Use Microsoft Entra Id to Secure CAP Fiori Application
entry.content:
I have an HTML5 application developed using SAP Fiori and CAP for Node.js. An XSUAA instance was created for security, and the application uses the Build Work Zone Managed App Router.

I want users to be able to browse the app even if they don’t have a BTP account. However, if they are part of our Microsoft tenant, they should be able to access and use the site.

I’m not sure how to achieve this. Any suggestions or resources would be highly appreciated. Thanks.

entry.title: SAP Workzone Local Entry Point Theme Manager not working properly
entry.content:
In our multi-tenant app we have set up theming on the subscriber.

All was working fine. The Admin user was able to publish and configure a custom theme to the subsriber Theme Manager, set it as default, and then when a user logged on to the LEP site they got the custom branding.

Now however when we publish the custom theme and try and set  "Enable User Selection" and "Set As Default" in the Theme Manager it looks like it saves but it doesnt.

In the Developer Tools -> Network tab we can see the 

  sap.cf.plugins.ThemeDesign.Component.saveChanges

calls POST https://<<subscriber>>mtx-approuter.cfapps.ap10.hana.ondemand.com/cp.portal/cep/content/v1

 
{
  "query": "\n                    mutation configureTheme($site_id: String!, $settings: ConfigurationSettingsInput!) {\n                        configureTheme(id: $site_id, settings: $settings)\n                    }\n                ",
  "variables": {
    "site_id": "default",
    "settings": {
      "value": {
        "/themeSettings": {
          "defaultTheme": "MegaCorpTheme",
          "availableThemes": [
            "sap_fiori_3",
            "sap_fiori_3_dark",
            "sap_horizon",
            "sap_horizon_dark",
            "sap_horizon_hcb",
            "sap_horizon_hcw",
            "MegaCorpTheme",
            "sap_horizon_set",
            "sap_fiori_3_set"
          ]
        }
      },
      "schemaVersion": "3.2.0"
    }
  }
}
 
it returns
 
{
    "errors": [
        {
            "message": "Request failed with status code 401",
            "path": [
                "configureTheme"
            ],
            "extensions": {
                "statusCode": "INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR"
            }
        }
    ],
    "data": {
        "configureTheme": null
    }
}

The message suggests the user doesnt have access but it does 

The admin user in the subscriber definitely has the theming and workzone admin roles assigned, see xs-security mapping

  "role-collections": [
    {
      "name": "Our App Admin LEP Role",
      "description": "Grant Administrative access to LEP",
      "role-template-references": [
..
        "$XSSERVICENAME(ourapp-mtx-workzone).Theme_Admin",
        "$XSSERVICENAME(ourapp-mtx-workzone).Super_Admin",
        "$XSSERVICENAME(ourapp-mtx-workzone).External_User",
        "$XSSERVICENAME(ourapp-theming).Editor",
        "$XSSERVICENAME(ourapp-theming).Publisher",
        "$XSSERVICENAME(ourapp-theming).Viewer",
      ]
    }

 @AmberXu @SAPSupport @IrisSasson @FabianBerr @rupambhatta

entry.title: SAP Workzone Local Entry Point providerId failing
entry.content:
We recently started to get this error when deploying our multi-tenant app

Spoiler
Error creating service "horizon-mtx-workzone" from offering "build-workzone-standard" and plan "local-entry-point": Service broker error: Service broker portal failed with: Failed to create service. The parameter 'providerId' can contain up to 20 alphanumeric characters, dots, (,) or underscore (_). . CorrelationId: 625b027a-13a9-4373-4547-2a40e43a08f6
Process failed.

The parameter 'providerId' can contain up to 20 alphanumeric characters, dots, (,) or underscore (_). Seems like a very odd constraint given it needs to be unique and repeatable.

We notice it doesnt like "-" anymore and yet all the examples and help show dashes

parameters:
      config:
        providerId: ga-${org}-${space}

if we use it works some of the times

    parameters:
      config:
        providerId:  ${org}

 But it doesnt work for out subaccounts where there is a "-" in the org (majority) 

This seems like a bug to me as it doesnt meet backwards compatibility and also means we cant update the workzone config

 @AmberXu @SAPSupport @IrisSasson @FabianBerr @rupambhatta

entry.title: Workzone hide card dynamically
entry.content:
Hi,

I would like to build a custom card for the SAP Workzone Standard Edition.

The card should display some news but in case there is nothing to show I would like to hide the card instead of displaying some generic content/ no data information.

I there a way to do this? I can set the visibility to false for the card in my component programatically but this will leave a gap in the layout on the workzone site as the container for the card remains on the DOM. 

Thanks.

Best Regards,

Juri

entry.title: How to deploy a custom application to a SAP partner demo customizing tenant?
entry.content:
Hi all,

I have create a RAP application in a client's tenant and deployed it to the BPT subbacount cloudfoundry.  The app is available through a site created in SAP Build Workzone.

My requirement is to have that same app available in a SAP Partner Demo Customizing tenant. Is this possible? and what's the best way to achieve this?

Thanks,

entry.title: SAP Build Workzone Space icons in side menu
entry.content:
Hi Topic Experts

Is there a planned feature to be able to change the icon for spaces inside SAP Build Workzone Standard Edition? It would be very helpful to distiguish the spaces visually (especially when the side menu is collapsed) by different (SAP) UI icons. 

If I can submit a feature request by a known channel, I'd be happy to do so. 

Many thanks and Best Regards 
Matthias

entry.title: HTML5 Application Migrated from NEO to Cloud Foundry Not Visible in BTP / Build Work Zone
entry.content:
We have a basic HTML (SAPUI5) application running on SAP NEO, which we are currently testing to migrate to SAP BTP Cloud Foundry.

We have completed the required configurations on the Cloud Foundry side and updated the following files accordingly:

  • xs-app.json

  • mta.yaml

  • xs-security.json

  • manifest.json

We successfully build the MTAR file and deploy it from SAP Business Application Studio (BAS). The deployment completes without any errors.

However, after deployment:

  • The application does not appear under HTML5 Applications in the SAP BTP cockpit

  • The application is also not visible in SAP Build Work Zone

  • We have already created an instance of HTML5 Application Repository Service with the app-host plan

Could you please help us understand:

  1. What could be the possible reasons for the application not appearing in HTML5 Applications or Build Work Zone?

  2. Are there any mandatory configurations or services (such as app-runtime, destination, XSUAA, or content module settings) that are commonly missed during NEO to Cloud Foundry migration?

  3. Are there any specific checks or logs we should verify after a successful MTAR deployment?

Any guidance or best practices for migrating HTML5 applications from NEO to Cloud Foundry would be greatly appreciated.

mta.yaml:

_schema-version: "3.2"
ID: test.getuserdetailsmta
version: 0.0.1
description: Generated by Fiori Tools

modules:
  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-app-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    path: .
    requires:
      - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-repo-host
      #- name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-runtime_new
        parameters:
          content-target: true
      - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-destination-service
    build-parameters:
      build-result: resources
      requires:
        - name: testgetuserdetailsmta
          artifacts:
            - dist.zip
          target-path: resources/

  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta
    type: html5
    path: .
    parameters:
      buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
    requires:
      - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-xsuaa
    build-parameters:
      builder: custom
      commands:
        - npm install
        - npm run build:cf
      build-result: dist
      supported-platforms: []

resources:
  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-repo-host
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: html5-apps-repo
      service-plan: app-host
      service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-service

  # - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-runtime_new
  #   type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  #   parameters:
  #     service: html5-apps-repo
  #     service-plan: app-runtime
  #     service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-runtime_new

  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-destination-service
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: destination
      service-plan: lite
      service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-destination-service
      config:
        HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
        init_data:
          instance:
            destinations:
              - Name: ui5
                URL: https://ui5.sap.com
                Type: HTTP
                ProxyType: Internet
                Authentication: NoAuthentication
            existing_destinations_policy: update
        version: 1.0.0

  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-xsuaa
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: xsuaa
      service-plan: application
      service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-xsuaa
      config:
        xsappname: testgetuserdetailsmta
        tenant-mode: dedicated
        scopes:
          - name: Display
            description: Display scope

parameters:
  deploy_mode: html5-repo
  enable-parallel-deployments: true

xs-app.json:
{
  "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^<apply-service-segment-path>/(.*)$",
      "target": "<apply-service-segment-path>/$1",
      "destination": "ui5",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "csrfProtection": false
    },
    {
      "source": "^/resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
    {
      "source": "^/test-resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/test-resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
    {
      "source": "^(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
    },
    {
    "source": "^/user-api(.*)",
    "target": "$1",
    "service": "sap-approuter-userapi"
}

  ]
}
xs-security.json:
{
  "xsappname": "test.getuserdetailsmta",
  "tenant-mode": "dedicated",
  "description": "Security profile of called application",
  "scopes": [],
  "role-templates": []
}
ui5-deploy.yaml:
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://sap.github.io/ui5-tooling/schema/ui5.yaml.json

specVersion: "4.0"
metadata:
  name: test.getuserdetailsmta
type: application
resources:
  configuration:
    propertiesFileSourceEncoding: UTF-8
builder:
  resources:
    excludes:
      - /test/**
      - /localService/**
  customTasks:
    - name: ui5-task-zipper
      afterTask: generateCachebusterInfo
      configuration:
        archiveName: testgetuserdetailsmta
        relativePaths: true
        additionalFiles:
          - xs-app.json
Can anyone assist on this?
 SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime and environment SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition SAPUI5

entry.title: Is it possible to extend SAP Task Center UI on SAP BTP?
entry.content:
I am currently working with SAP Task Center on SAP BTP, accessed through SAP Build Work Zone.

I would like to know if there is any possibility to extend the user interface, for example by adding custom buttons, actions, or business-specific UI elements, in order to improve the user experience when handling tasks.

My goal is to understand the supported extensibility options and limitations for SAP Task Center within SAP BTP.

entry.title: Is there a way to export site launchpad config from BTP NEO in an Excel Spreadsheet
entry.content:
With the SAP BTP NEO sunset, we are working on migration Project of Launchpad from NEO to cloud foundary &/ Workzone.

In neo we have Role-->Catalog-->App relationship and some 500 (Apps, catalogs & Roles) objects with 1200 references.

Where as in Workzone the relation ship is Role to App or spaces& pages,

Though the site is migrated and imported into workzone, the previous relationship of objects differ and so we need to consolidate roles --> Apps & Roles to Catalog.

Is there a way to export NEO site's config in an excel spreadsheet, for easy reference & look up?

I couldn't find a out of box solution.

Thank you,
Sai

entry.title: Combining apps from different Work Zone Content Providers/Packages in one CDM
entry.content:
--- Please ignore this question  --- See here  https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/combining-apps-cards-from-multiple-content-providers-packages-in-one-cdm/qaq-p/14308986 ---

Dear experts in this space and dear broader SAP community, 

I am trying to combine apps from different Work Zone Content Providers/Packages in one CDM (Common Data Model) definition of another Content Provider. Example - One Content Package/Provider is providing some cards/apps to my Work Zone tenant, and I would like to consume these cards/apps in a Work Space CDM definition of another Content Provider. 

Similar things can be done using the Work Zone Content Manager allowing to combine apps/cards from different Content Providers/Packages into one Work Page. Nevertheless, I couldn't figure out how to do this within a CDM definition. Prefixing the app ID with the other Content Provider ID (see below) did not do the job (e.g., content.provider_app.id). Any help or input is highly appreciated. 

My goal is to have a CDM, that contains a Work Page, that references apps from multiple other Content Packages/Providers. 

@matthias_schmalz @gregorw @jmargieh - Maybe you have already done something similar?

Thanks in advance and all the best, 
Martin

{
    "_version": "3.2.0",
    "identification": {
      "id": "combined-workpage",
      "entityType": "workpage",
      "title": "{{Title}}"
    },
    "payload": {
      "workpageConfig": {
        "title": "Combined Work Page"
      },
      "rows": [
        {
          "id": "row-1",
          "rowConfig": {},
          "columns": [
            {
              "id": "col-11",
              "columnConfig": {},
              "cells": [
                {
                  "id": "cell-11",
                  "cellConfig": {},
                  "widgets": [
                    {
                      "id": "widg-11",
                      "viz": {
                        "appId": "other.package_cards.forecast.app",
                        "vizId": "other.package_cards.forecast.viz" 
                      }
                    },
                    {
                      "id": "widg-12",
                      "viz": {
                        "appId": "applocalprovider",
                        "vizId": "applocalprovider-display"
                      }
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    "texts": [
      {
        "locale": "",
        "textDictionary": {
          "Title": "User Page"
        }
      }
    ]
  },

entry.title: Combining apps/cards from multiple Content Providers/Packages in one CDM (Common Data Model)
entry.content:
Dear experts in this space and dear broader SAP community, 

I am trying to combine apps from different Work Zone Content Providers/Packages in one CDM (Common Data Model) definition of another Content Provider. Example - One Content Package/Provider is providing some cards/apps to my Work Zone tenant, and I would like to consume these cards/apps in a Work Space CDM definition of another Content Provider. 

Similar things can be done using the Work Zone Content Manager allowing to combine apps/cards from different Content Providers/Packages into one Work Page. Nevertheless, I couldn't figure out how to do this within a CDM definition. Prefixing the app ID with the other Content Provider ID (see below) did not do the job (e.g., content.provider_app.id). Any help or input is highly appreciated. 

My goal is to have a CDM, that contains a Work Page, that references apps from multiple other Content Packages/Providers. 

@matthias_schmalz @gregorw @jmargieh - Maybe you have already done something similar?

Thanks in advance and all the best, 
Martin

 

{
    "_version": "3.2.0",
    "identification": {
      "id": "combined-workpage",
      "entityType": "workpage",
      "title": "{{Title}}"
    },
    "payload": {
      "workpageConfig": {
        "title": "Combined Work Page"
      },
      "rows": [
        {
          "id": "row-1",
          "rowConfig": {},
          "columns": [
            {
              "id": "col-11",
              "columnConfig": {},
              "cells": [
                {
                  "id": "cell-11",
                  "cellConfig": {},
                  "widgets": [
                    {
                      "id": "widg-11",
                      "viz": {
                        "appId": "other.package_cards.forecast.app",
                        "vizId": "other.package_cards.forecast.viz" 
                      }
                    },
                    {
                      "id": "widg-12",
                      "viz": {
                        "appId": "applocalprovider",
                        "vizId": "applocalprovider-display"
                      }
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    "texts": [
      {
        "locale": "",
        "textDictionary": {
          "Title": "User Page"
        }
      }
    ]
  },
